definition: to reside/to live/to dwell/to be in/to be situated at/to stay/to get along with/to be in a position of/to deal with/to discipline/to punish
place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point
to decide/to determine/to execute (sb)/(of a dam etc) to breach or burst/definitely/certainly

sentences.english: And earlier this month, the government executed its top food-and-drug regulator after convicting him on bribery charges.
sentences.chinese: 本月初，政府因受贿罪处决了原国家药检局的局长。

sentences.english: These charts do not include counts of deserters , those convicted or executed, etc.
sentences.chinese: 这些表格尚不包括逃兵，被宣判及被处决的人，等等。

sentences.english: The man who murdered his wife was executed according to law.
sentences.chinese: 那个杀妻犯被依法处决了。
那个凶残的匪首被处决了。

sentences.english: The loyal clone troopers executed their treasonous Jedi generals in cold blood.
sentences.chinese: 忠诚的克隆人士兵冷酷地处决了叛国的绝地将军们。

sentences.english: Luo Daquan should execute Mrs Chen, be held off by old sister-in-law however.
sentences.chinese: 罗大全要处决陈太太，却被陈大嫂挡住。

sentences.english: Tamson orders the public execution of the prince.
sentences.chinese: 塔姆森命令公开处决王子。

sentences.english: The world is but a large prison, out of which some sre daily selected for execution. ---W. Raleigh.
sentences.chinese: 这个世界不过是一座大监狱，每天选出一些人被处决。

sentences.english: Nevertheless the local judiciary has insisted that Hamidi should be executed.
sentences.chinese: 尽管如此，当地司法部门仍坚持，哈米迪应该被处决。

sentences.english: They were however apprehended and promptly executed.
sentences.chinese: 然而，他们被逮捕并迅速被处决。

sentences.english: He is believed to have been executed with an antiaircraft gun.
sentences.chinese: 据信玄永哲是被用高射炮处决。

sentences.english: Screed was ultimately killed by Warlord Zsinj during his rise to power.
sentences.chinese: 但他最终还是被日益强大的军阀津奇处决了。

sentences.english: On the other side of the circle, there was a public execution ground.
sentences.chinese: 广场另一侧是处决犯人的法场。

sentences.english: Emperor North said John Brown never should have been executed.
sentences.chinese: 北帝说约翰布朗不应该被处决。

sentences.english: Lin Qianru learned from the newspaper that Jiao Zhixin had been executed.
sentences.chinese: 林倩如从报上得知焦志新被处决的消息当场昏倒。

sentences.english: Before Rackham's execution, Bonny was allowed to visit him in his cell.
sentences.chinese: 拉克姆被处决前，邦尼获准到囚室探望。

definition: an execution/to put sb to death
to execute by firing squad/same as 槍斃|枪毙
to hang (i.e. execute by hanging)/to strangle
to execute by firing squad/to shoot dead/fig. to discard/to get rid of
public trial (in a court of law)
to behead sb and display the head in public
